author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

The robot thinks you are trying to register General. I think you need to invoke it from your package's repository, e.g. by commenting on https://github.com/djpasseyjr/Shrike.jl/commit/e923258c3b0a636581ab42167b55bffd8479e1ed 

[noblock]

Is there anything that I need to do before this can be merged? Do I just need to wait for a person to review, as far as I can see the package meets the requirements for automatic merging now

[noblock]

> Do I just need to wait for a person to review

In principle no, but in order for automerge to work _**all**_ comments must have `[noblock]` in them, but messages [one](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/41765#issuecomment-889178288), [two](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/41765#issuecomment-889178304) and [three](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/41765#issuecomment-889206010) were missing it, and this pull request simply slipped down the list of open pull requests.

You could have either deleted your own extra messages or edited them to add `[noblock]`, but in this case you couldn't do much for the message by JuliaRegistrator.
